newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's Costello cautious on Darwin rail link.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Costello cautious on Darwin rail link.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Tuesday the commercial vialibity of the planned Alice Springs to Darwin rail link should be demonstrated before it could be considered for funding under the Federation Fund.
"We are not going to build something which is not commercial so it is important that it be looked at very carefully from the economic point of view," he told reporters after a business luncheon.
Costello would not respond to a question about whether the Federation Fund criteria were tailor-made for long-proposed rail link, saying he could not get into naming specific projects.
The Australian government, in its 1997/98 budget, announced it would establish a A$1.0 billion fund to celebrate the centenary of the country's federation in 1901.
The money would be used to pay for projects of national significance, including infrastructure, Costello said last Tuesday when he released the budget.
